page.title: 01TILMANSTONE-DOWNLAND VILLAGE
page.content:
{ Tilmanstone}lies at the eastern end of the North Downs between the Port of {Dover}and the Cinque Port of{Sandwich. 13 km. from{Deal}and 22 km. from the Cathedral City of{Canterbury.}An area of undulating downland, varying from 25 to 75 m. above sea-level.
The village is situated below the A256{Dover}to{Ramsgate}road, which runs along the line of two Roman roads to{Richborough Castle.}Saxon and Norman habitation are also evident.
The area now comprises a village of 77 dwellings, population 230 ; Parish Church, hall, Elderly Persons Home, two Public Houses, and Post Office/ General Store. There are six farms, mixed arable and livestock; a section of North Downs Way; woodland and {Tilmanstone Colliery.
